decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:Drawing no: 015-ECT-A-00-LP-101/Rev1 (Existing Site Location Plan) Dated 15/02/2023 . 
Drawing no: 015-ECT-A-00-SP-103/Rev1 (Proposed Site Plan) Dated 15/02/2023 
Drawing no. 015-ECT-A-00-GA-101/Rev1 (Proposed Ground Floor Plan) Dated 15/02/23 
Drawing no. 015-ECT-A-01-GA-102/Rev1 (PROPOED FIRST FLOOR PLAN ) Dated 15/02/23  
Drawing no. 015-ECT-A-02-GA-103/Rev1 (Proposed Roof Plan) Dated 15/02/23   
Drawing no. 015-ECT-A-XX-EL-101/Rev1(Proposed Elevations 1 AND 2 PLAN) Dated 15/02/23.
Drawing no: 015-ECT-A-XX-EL-102/Rev 1 (PROPOSED ELEVATIONS 3 and 4 Plan) Dated 15/02/23. 
Drawing no: 015 -ECT - A- XX -SE - 101/Rev1(Proposed Sections 1 and 2) Dated15/02/23. 
Drawing no: 015-ECT-A-XX-SK-101/Rev 1 (PROPOSED 3D VIEW) Dated15/02/23. 
COMBINED DESIGN & ACCESS STATEMENT AND HERITAGE STATEMENT Document No. 015-ECT-A-XX-SK-101 Rev. 01 Dated 22.05.2023

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - No Use of Flat Roof  - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 5 - Obscured Glazing - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the window in the south elevation at first floor level shall be glazed with obscured glass and shall be maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 6 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF 2021 , The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   iii) The application was approved without delay.
description:
APPLICATION FOR ADDITION OF AN INTERNAL LIFT, SKYLIGHTS TO ROOF, 
CONVERTING FIRST FLOOR ROOF TO A BEDROOM WITH AN EN-SUITE, 
ALONG WITH THE ADDITION OF TWO WINDOWS TO THE EXISTING HOUSE
